definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Conclusion In-home survey is rather difficult to conduct.
sentences.chinese: 結論入戶調查仍有一定困難。

sentences.english: Ring the police if there is a burglary.
sentences.chinese: 如果發生入戶盜竊就給警方打電話。

sentences.english: The vestibule is a special transit space from outdoor to indoor.
sentences.chinese: “玄關”是由戶外入戶的過渡專用空間。

sentences.english: Six Central American countries improved their household surveys on living standards.
sentences.chinese: 六個中美洲國家完善了生活水平入戶調查方法。

sentences.english: Technology must go into villages and peasant households for high yield and high efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 全面推進科技進村入戶，推廣增產增效技術。

sentences.english: Methods In a certain community, some families in 10 buildings were chosen randomly and investigated.
sentences.chinese: 方法在某小區，隨機選擇10棟樓，開展入戶調查。

sentences.english: METHODS An investigation was made by cluster and stratified sampling method.
sentences.chinese: 方法採用多階段分層整羣抽樣方法入戶調查。

sentences.english: Household surveys indicate that a very high proportion of these nets are actually being used.
sentences.chinese: 入戶調查表明，這些蚊帳的實際使用比例非常高。

sentences.english: The salary of home infants' nurse can reach 10,000 at most per month.
sentences.chinese: 入戶育嬰師每月收入最高已能達到萬元。

sentences.english: The entrance of Shen Junru's old house and the wooden stairs.
sentences.chinese: 沈鈞儒舊居入戶門及舊居內的木質樓梯。

sentences.english: Larger crops from the home garden will do better with the Bag method using large zip-lock bags.
sentences.chinese: 從入戶花園的收成會做的更好，袋大袋拉鍊鎖的方法。

definition: couplet (hung on each side of the door frame)
to be on the move/to roam or wander/to circulate (of goods or capital)
doorstep/sill/threshold/fig. knack or trick (esp. scheme to get sth cheaper)
